member.summary: Defines the arguments used in the authentication callback.

member.summary: Gets the URI of the authority from where the access token should be obtained.

member.summary: Gets the URI of the target resource, the recipient of the access token.

member.summary: Gets the audience of the authentication request.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Authentication.AccessTokenCredentials
member.summary: Allows providing credentials for accessing a REST service from a service client. The service client provides the client application access token, previously obtained from the authority server, to the server for authentication.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Authentication.AccessTokenCredentials.AccessToken
member.summary: Gets the client application access token, previously obtained from the authority server.

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Authentication.AccessTokenCredentials.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The client application access token, previously obtained from the authority server.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Authentication.AuthenticationCallbackCredentials
member.summary: Allows providing credentials for accessing a REST service from a service client. The service client provides the credentials from a callback. This callback is invoked by the service client before sending a request and the callback parameters contain the information required for the client to obtain the access token from the authority server.
member.remarks: This kind of credentials is useful to interact with the authority server without knowing its address in advance (meaning that the authority server does not need to be hard-coded in the client).

member.name: E:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Authentication.AuthenticationCallbackCredentials.OnAuthenticate
member.summary: Callback invoked to get the access token.

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Authentication.AuthenticationCallbackCredentials.#ctor(System.Func{Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.AuthenticationCallbackArgs,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{System.String}})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The callback that should be used to obtain the access token.

member.summary: Describes an error raised while interacting with the authority server.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no inner exception is specified.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Authentication.ClientCredentials
member.summary: Allows providing credentials for accessing a REST service from a service client. The service client provides the client application identity to the server for authentication using the client credentials flow. The infrastructure will interact with the authority server to obtain the corresponding access token.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Authentication.ClientCredentials.AuthorityServer
member.summary: Gets the base URI of the authority server. This URI will be used to get the access token for the client.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Authentication.ClientCredentials.ClientId
member.summary: Gets the client application identifier.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Authentication.ClientCredentials.ClientSecret
member.summary: Gets the client application secret.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Authentication.ClientCredentials.Scope
member.summary: Gets the scope that the client application is trying to access. The scope is optional. If no scope is provided the access token returned will contain all the scopes allowed for the client.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Authentication.ClientCredentials.CredentialStyle
member.summary: Gets the client credential style. The default value is .

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Authentication.ClientCredentials.TokenCacheEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the cache should be enabled for . The default value is true.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Authentication.ClientCredentials.AccessToken
member.summary: Gets the client application access token, previously obtained from the authority server.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of to authorize the service client using the client credentials flow using the specified scope.
member.param: The base address of the authority server. Required to retrieve the access token.
The scope that the client is trying to access.
member.returns: The instance.
member.remarks: When this factory method is used the access token will contain only the specified scope.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of to authorize the service client using the client credentials flow using the specified scope.
member.param: The base address of the authority server. Required to retrieve the access token.
The scope that the client is trying to access.
The that should be used to communicate with the authority server.
member.returns: The instance.
member.remarks: When this factory method is used the access token will contain only the specified scope.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of to authorize the service client using the client credentials flow using all allowed scopes.
member.param: The base address of the authority server. Required to retrieve the access token.
member.returns: The instance.
member.remarks: When this factory method is used the access token will contain all the scopes allowed for the client (if the client is configured to allow that).

member.returns: The instance.
member.remarks: When this factory method is used the access token will contain all the scopes allowed for the client (if the client is configured to allow that).

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The challenge is not bearer..

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Properties.Resources.RES_Exception_HttpBearerChallenge_ChallengeNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The response does not contain a valid HTTP Bearer challenge. The WWW-Authenticate header does not include a bearer challenge. WWW-Authenticate header: '{0}'..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The response does not contain a valid HTTP Bearer challenge. The bearer challenge was found but it has invalid properties. WWW-Authenticate header: '{0}'..

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Properties.Resources.RES_Exception_HttpBearerChallenge_WWWAuthenticateNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The response does not contain a valid HTTP Bearer challenge. The WWW-Authenticate header was not found..

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Properties.Resources.RES_Exception_InvalidChallengeParameters1
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Invalid challenge parameters. The challenge must contain at least one parameter..

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.Properties.Resources.RES_Exception_InvalidChallengeParameters2
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Invalid challenge parameters. The challenge does not contain the 'authorization' of 'authorization_uri' parameter..

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.RetryDelegatingHandler.DefaultBackoffDelta
member.summary: Gets the value by default that will be used to calculate a random delta in the exponential delay between retries. The default value is 5 seconds.

member.summary: Gets the maximum backoff time by default. The default value is 5 seconds.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.RetryDelegatingHandler.DefaultMinBackoff
member.summary: Gets the minimum backoff time by default. The default value is 1 second.

member.summary: Gets or sets the base URI of the service.

member.summary: Gets or sets the credentials use to access the service.

member.summary: Gets or sets the API version.

member.summary: Gets or sets the instance in use to communicate with the service.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Rest.Client.ServiceClient`1.HttpMessageHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the instance in use to communicate with the service. This is the innermost HTTP handler (the end of the send HTTP pipeline).
member.remarks: If an handler is provided in the service client initialization, this property will be a reference to it. Otherwise it will reference the default that is created automatically when no handler is provider in the service client initialization.

member.summary: Gets the user agent headers collection.

member.summary: Gets or sets the first HTTP handler (the start of the send HTTP pipeline).

member.summary: Gets the client version used to set the user-agent.
